00022 #include "system.h"
00023 #include "serial.h"
00024 #include "settings.h"
00025 #include "protocol.h"
00026 #include "gcode.h"
00027 #include "planner.h"
00028 #include "stepper.h"
00029 #include "spindle_control.h"
00030 #include "coolant_control.h"
00031 #include "motion_control.h"
00032 #include "limits.h"
00033 #include "probe.h"
00034 #include "report.h"
00035 
00036 
00037 // Declare system global variable structure
00038 system_t sys; 
00039 
00040 
00041 int main(void)
00042 {
00043   // Initialize system upon power-up.
00044   serial_init();   // Setup serial baud rate and interrupts
00045   settings_init(); // Load grbl settings from EEPROM
00046   stepper_init();  // Configure stepper pins and interrupt timers
00047   system_init();   // Configure pinout pins and pin-change interrupt
00048   
00049   memset(&sys, 0, sizeof(sys));  // Clear all system variables
00050   sys.abort = true;   // Set abort to complete initialization
00051   sei(); // Enable interrupts
00052 
00053   // Check for power-up and set system alarm if homing is enabled to force homing cycle
00054   // by setting Grbl's alarm state. Alarm locks out all g-code commands, including the
00055   // startup scripts, but allows access to settings and internal commands. Only a homing
00056   // cycle '$H' or kill alarm locks '$X' will disable the alarm.
00057   // NOTE: The startup script will run after successful completion of the homing cycle, but
00058   // not after disabling the alarm locks. Prevents motion startup blocks from crashing into
00059   // things uncontrollably. Very bad.
00060   #ifdef HOMING_INIT_LOCK
00061     if (bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_HOMING_ENABLE)) { sys.state = STATE_ALARM; }
00062   #endif
00063   
00064   // Grbl initialization loop upon power-up or a system abort. For the latter, all processes
00065   // will return to this loop to be cleanly re-initialized.
00066   for(;;) {
00067 
00068     // TODO: Separate configure task that require interrupts to be disabled, especially upon
00069     // a system abort and ensuring any active interrupts are cleanly reset.
00070   
00071     // Reset Grbl primary systems.
00072     serial_reset_read_buffer(); // Clear serial read buffer
00073     gc_init(); // Set g-code parser to default state
00074     spindle_init();
00075     coolant_init();
00076     limits_init(); 
00077     probe_init();
00078     plan_reset(); // Clear block buffer and planner variables
00079     st_reset(); // Clear stepper subsystem variables.
00080 
00081     // Sync cleared gcode and planner positions to current system position.
00082     plan_sync_position();
00083     gc_sync_position();
00084 
00085     // Reset system variables.
00086     sys.abort = false;
00087     sys.execute = 0;
00088     if (bit_istrue(settings.flags,BITFLAG_AUTO_START)) { sys.auto_start = true; }
00089     else { sys.auto_start = false; }
00090           
00091     // Start Grbl main loop. Processes program inputs and executes them.
00092     protocol_main_loop();
00093     
00094   }
00095   return 0;   /* Never reached */
00096 }
